resources.string: Speed up your exam preparation with 30 minutes a day.
Which exam are you preparing for?
Prepare for everyday English use and immigration.
Improve your academic English for university entry.
Boost your English skills for studying abroad.
Learn German for work and daily life.
Enhance your English for academic and government exams.
Prepare for Turkey’s university language exam.
Log in and continue working where you left off
By joining, I declare that I have read and accept the Terms and Privacy Policy.
Register and access carefully prepared exam resources.
Could you tell us a little about yourself?
Why do you want to take the %1$s test?
I need this certification to apply for university programs that require a language proficiency test.
I want to improve my career opportunities by demonstrating my language skills to employers.
I’m planning to move abroad, and this test is necessary for my visa or residency application.
I enjoy learning languages, and taking this test is a great way to measure my progress.
My goal is to become a language teacher, and passing this exam is a key requirement for my qualification.
You can write more details about your\nreason for taking the test here.
We\'re not sure there\'s anything we can teach you !

The Level Determination Exam is designed solely to assess your grammar proficiency. For a more comprehensive evaluation, you can take the Advanced Level Exam available in the app. This exam is structured in accordance with international exam formats such as IELTS and TOEFL.
Designed by Antoni Gaudí, Sagrada Família is a world-famous Catholic basilica. Construction began in 1882 and is still ongoing. It is considered one of the masterpieces of modernist architecture.

Located at the north end of the Palace of Westminster, the clock tower is popularly known as “Big Ben.” In fact, Big Ben is the name of the great bell inside the tower. It is one of England’s iconic landmarks.
Dating back to Ancient Rome, the Colosseum is a massive amphitheater where gladiator fights and public spectacles were held. Opened in AD 80, it remains the largest standing Roman structure.

Built by Gustave Eiffel for the 1889 Paris World’s Fair, the Eiffel Tower is the most recognizable symbol of Paris. Made of iron, it was controversial at the time but is now an iconic example of French engineering.
Originally built as a church in 537, Hagia Sophia has served as a mosque and a museum. Combining Byzantine and Ottoman architecture, it is one of Istanbul’s most iconic landmarks.

Believed to have been constructed between 3000 and 2000 BC, Stonehenge is a mysterious monument made of massive stone blocks. Its purpose remains unknown, making it one of the world’s most famous prehistoric sites.
Built in the 12th century by the Khmer Empire, Angkor Wat is the world’s largest temple complex. It is considered sacred in both Hinduism and Buddhism.
Constructed during the Nasrid dynasty, the Alhambra Palace is one of the finest examples of Islamic architecture. It is famous for its gardens, courtyards, and intricate decorations.
Built in the 18th century, the Brandenburg Gate is a symbol of Berlin and German reunification. Its classical architecture makes it one of the city’s most important landmarks.
A symbol of American independence, this statue was gifted to the USA by France in 1886. It represents the ideals of freedom and democracy.
Commissioned by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan for his wife Mumtaz Mahal, this mausoleum is built of white marble and is considered a symbol of love.
This ancient city from the Inca Empire is located in the Andes Mountains and is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.
An ancient city carved into red rock, Petra is also known as the "Rose City" and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
The world’s longest defensive wall, the Great Wall of China was built to protect the northern borders and is said to be the only man-made structure visible from space.
Opened in 1973, the Sydney Opera House is a masterpiece of modern architecture with its unique sail-shaped roof. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and the most recognizable symbol of Australia.
Located atop Corcovado Mountain, Christ the Redeemer was completed in 1931. This 30-meter-tall statue is one of the most important symbols of Rio de Janeiro and Brazil.

Built by the Genoese in 1348, Galata Tower is one of the oldest and most iconic structures in Istanbul. It offers panoramic views of the city and has served as a watchtower, fire lookout, and prison throughout its history.
Famous for its leaning structure, the Pisa Tower was built between 1173 and 1372. This bell tower, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is one of Italy\'s most visited tourist attractions.
The Acropolis, one of the most important structures of Ancient Greek civilization, is famous for the Parthenon Temple. Built in the 5th century BC, it is a symbol of Athens and Western civilization.
The political and historical center of Russia, the Kremlin was built in the 15th century. This UNESCO World Heritage Site is a complex of palaces, cathedrals, and fortifications.
Our mystery game is under development. It will be here very soon! Get ready for surprises 🎉
